title: Myofascial Pain Syndrome Management
content: Myofascial pain syndrome involves pain and inflammation in the body's soft tissues, characterized by trigger points. Treatment includes trigger point pressure release techniques, dry needling, spray-and-stretch methods, and appropriate stretching programs. Heat therapy, ultrasound, and electrical stimulation may provide adjunctive relief. Addressing perpetuating factors such as posture, ergonomics, and stress is essential for long-term management.
